example.eg: Sarah had to buy a hammer and nails so she could hang her pictures on the walls of her new apartment.
example.egtrans: 莎拉须要一把锤子和一些钉子，来把照片挂在新公寓的墙上。

example.eg: Ron hammered the nails into the board.
example.egtrans: 罗恩用锤子把钉子钉在板子上。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 用锤子敲, 用榔头砸

example.eg: The boxer hammered his opponent into the ground.
example.egtrans: 拳击手将对手击倒在地。

dsense.name: hammer
dsense.guideword: (part of a mechanism) (枪炮装置等的)

example.eg: Derek pulled the hammer back on his gun.
example.egtrans: 德里克拉动枪上的击铁。

example.eg: In this event, athletes throw a hammer weighing over seven kilograms.
The hammer is one of the small bones of the middle ear.
The smith hammered at the chunk of steel for hours.
example.egtrans: 铁匠锤铁块锤了几小时。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 锤, 用锤子砸, 敲

example.eg: Jim hammered on the door with his fist.
The smith hammered the horseshoe into shape.
example.egtrans: 铁匠用锤子将铁块锤成马蹄铁的形状。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 用锤子锤, 用锤子敲

example.eg: Jon's mother tried very hard to hammer good manners into him during his childhood.
example.egtrans: 母亲在乔恩童年时期非常努力地向他灌输良好的行为举止。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 强力灌输, 大力灌输

example.eg: Joanne hammered at the door to get John's attention.
Harry is very hardworking; he just hammers away until the task is done.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 埋头苦干, 坚持不懈

example.eg: If you want to finish your novel, you need to just hammer away at it every day.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 锲而不舍, 不懈努力

dsense.name: hammer away at [sb]
dsense.guideword: informal, figurative (try to persuade) (非正式用语)

example.eg: I hammered away at my boss until he finally agreed to give me a raise.
I hammered in a nail to hang the picture on.
She meticulously reviewed her flashcards to hammer in the new vocabulary words before her exam.
The drummer hammered out a rhythm and the band began to play.
Though they had differing viewpoints, John and Sally hammered out a compromise.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 经详细讨论做出, 仔细推敲出

example.eg: The construction crew had to use an air hammer to break up the concrete walkway.

dsense.name: drop forge, drop hammer, drop press
go under the hammer
dsense.guideword: figurative (be offered for sale at auction)

example.eg: The building, which dates back to the 1870s, is to go under the hammer later this month.
The hammer and sickle is a communist symbol.
Before we buy the materials, let's hammer down a work schedule.
